analysis.Summary: Vue component that renders a resizable textarea for editing bullet-point lists. It parses input lines starting with '-' or '*' into an array of bullet items, updates the parent prop accordingly, auto-resizes the textarea height, and emits events when the block is focused or deleted.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a reusable UI element in the constructor module for capturing and managing a list of bullet points, keeping the parent data structure in sync and handling empty-list cleanup.

Components.name: Bullets
Components.responsibility: Render and manage a textarea input for bullet items, parse and store the bullets in a prop array, auto-resize the input, and emit lifecycle events.

Functions.name: handleInput
Functions.purpose: Parse textarea content into an array of bullet lines (stripping leading '-' or '*'), update the bound prop, and trigger a resize.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The input event from the textarea element.

Functions.name: focus
Functions.purpose: Programmatically focus the textarea after the next DOM update.

Functions.name: resize
Functions.purpose: Reset and adjust the textarea's height to fit its scrollHeight, ensuring the textarea grows/shrinks with content.

Dependencies: vue (ref, computed, onMounted, onUpdated, watch, nextTick)
analysis.Usage: Imported as `<Bullets>` in parent Vue components. Props such as `prop`, `content`, `placeholder`, and event listeners for `deleteBlock`, `addBlock`, and `focus` must be provided. Example: `import Bullets from 'modules/constructor/components/elements/Bullets.vue'` then `<Bullets :prop="item" content="lines" @deleteBlock="removeItem" />`.
Notes: Watches the bound bullet array and emits 'deleteBlock' when it becomes empty.
Auto-resizing logic runs on mount and every update.
Uses a `tabindex="-1"` to exclude the textarea from normal tab order.
The `data` ref wrapping `props` is declared but not directly used elsewhere.
